content:
I'm having trouble proving the left direction of the pullback lemma. First I'll write how I proved the right direction with morphism as below:
image.png

To prove the ⇒\Rightarrow⇒ part (R and L being PB implies that L+R is PB):

  • Suppose fmi=gjfmi = gjfmi=gj. To show that L+R is a pullback, we need to show that there exists a unique zzz such that fmi=fmnzfmi = fmnzfmi=fmnz and gj=gkezgj = gkezgj=gkez.
  • Because fmi=gjfmi = gjfmi=gj, by the UP of the right pullback, ∃!y:fmi=fhy=gky=gj\exists!y : fmi = fhy = gky = gj∃!y:fmi=fhy=gky=gj.
  • Because mi=hymi = hymi=hy, by the UP of the left pullback ∃!x:mi=mnx=hex=hy\exists!x : mi = mnx = hex = hy∃!x:mi=mnx=hex=hy.

  • Take xxx as zzz:

    1. Because mi=mnxmi = mnxmi=mnx then fmi=fmnxfmi = fmnxfmi=fmnx.
    2. Because fh=gkfh = gkfh=gk (R commutes by assumption) and hy=hexhy = hexhy=hex, we can combine this as gj=fhy=fhex=gkexgj = fhy = fhex = gkexgj=fhy=fhex=gkex and we are done.

Now continuing with the following:
image.png

To prove the ⇐\Leftarrow⇐ direction (L+R and R being PB implies that L is PB):

  • Suppose mi=hjmi = hjmi=hj. Our goal is to show ∃!x\exists!x∃!x such that mi=mnxmi = mnxmi=mnx and hj=hexhj = hexhj=hex.
  • Because fmi=gkjfmi = gkjfmi=gkj, by UP of R being a PB, ∃!y:fmi=fhy=gky=gkj\exists!y : fmi = fhy = gky = gkj∃!y:fmi=fhy=gky=gkj.
  • Because fmi=gkjfmi = gkjfmi=gkj, by UP of L+R being a PB, ∃!z:fmi=fmnz=gkez=gkj\exists!z : fmi = fmnz = gkez = gkj∃!z:fmi=fmnz=gkez=gkj.

  • Take zzz as xxx:

    1. From fmi=fmnzfmi = fmnzfmi=fmnz I need to conclude that mi=mnzmi = mnzmi=mnz, which is true if fff is monic, but I don't have that as an assumption. In the ⇒\Rightarrow⇒ direction there is no issue because we are just applying fff to things that are equal.
    2. If I just read from the diagram I can see that hj=hy=hezhj = hy = hezhj=hy=hez, and I have that he=mnhe = mnhe=mn by assumption, so again if I could conclude from fmi=fmnzfmi = fmnzfmi=fmnz that mi=mnzmi = mnzmi=mnz, then I could get hj=mi=mnz=hezhj = mi = mnz = hezhj=mi=mnz=hez, but this is of course the same problem as in 1. I think for a proper proof I need something more than "just follow the diagram", but I think I am missing an obvious assumption in my chasing attempt.
Whops, the bbb in the picture above is supposed to be jjj

I think you do not have the right definition of pullback. For instance, in the first direction, you say

Suppose fmi=gjfmi = gjfmi=gj. To show that L+R is a pullback, we need to show that there exists a unique zzz such that fmi=fmnzfmi = fmnzfmi=fmnz and gj=gkezgj = gkezgj=gkez.

But that is not enough, you should show zzz is unique such that nz=inz = inz=i and kez=jkez = jkez=j.
